intro: Melandrium umbellatum, commonly known as the common catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers in clusters, and its stems are covered in fine, silky hairs. It is characterized by its alternate leaves and capsule fruits that release tiny seeds. Melandrium umbellatum is often found in moist or sandy soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
